channel.title: Gay Marriage
channel.description:
Okay, i know this is a touchy subject, but i want to see how people feel.
I think that everyone should be able to wed the person they believe is the love of their life...no matter what sex the partner is. I don't think it should be up to the Government to decide.
Discuss

item.title: Gay Marriage
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“n33bz0rpl0x, post:69, topic:226624”]ya

Dink of nuts u tucker

thats what donut stats for[/quote]

Too bad no one understands what the hell that means, let alone cares. it doesn’t sound insulting at all. Really the arguing is just spam, the thread would be more enjoyable/mature/interesting if there weren’t any posts that have nothing to do with the subject.

Ontopic~ This thread reminds me of a thread on another forum that had something to do with relationships have nothing to do with your lifestyle and putting the word lifestyle in front of your relationship type is irrelevant.

Example: homosexual lifestyle.

It has everything to do with your lifestyle, I made a more informative post on there but the point is, it determines if you [i]make[/] life or not. As for if it is acceptable, I don’t think it matters. Just as long as they are happy, everyone deserves to be happy.

Read full topic

item.title: Gay Marriage
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

I figure its all what the normal society thinks that effects the approval. Really, everyone thinks its unacceptable due to their religion or just because it isn’t “normal”. Still normal is undefinable because of its various descriptions, but most think its just odd to see something they don’t see every day. Opinions are agreed and discriminated every day all the time. It just matters where you are and how everyone else sees it. biased is all it is. I figure if you want to get married to someone the same sex, go ahead it’s your life. It’s just a disappointment that some have to ruin that for others. My biology teacher said that the rain forest is one of the most healthy social environments if it was applied to modern society. It’s because the more the variety, the more you see and experience. Anyone who’s stopping differences from happening, is sort of, well. selfish.

Yz85Racer:

“do what you want to do, be who you want to be”.

I like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Gay Marriage
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:57, topic:226624”]I only just the other week changed my view on this but; being gay 90% of the time isn’t a choice.

And I think its down to the fucking hormones people are abusing today. For example “The Pill” which was introduced what in the 60s? To my knowledge what it does is gives a woman too much estrogen(sp) hormones which leads to her being unable to conceive a child until she stops. Did it not occur to anyone that putting an imbalance of hormones into a mother may lead to her child having fucked up hormones too?

Therefore the child, perhaps a boy? Has fucked up hormones, this leads to confuse a person in to which sex they prefer. Making the child homosexual.

Am I crazy or what?[/quote]

How do you explain the rampant homosexuality amongst prehistoric societys and animals, though?

Read full topic

item.title: Gay Marriage
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:60, topic:226624”][quote author=jme link=topic=297807.msg2405156#msg2405156 date=1219686482]

I only just the other week changed my view on this but; being gay 90% of the time isn’t a choice.

And I think its down to the fucking hormones people are abusing today. For example “The Pill” which was introduced what in the 60s? To my knowledge what it does is gives a woman too much estrogen(sp) hormones which leads to her being unable to conceive a child until she stops. Did it not occur to anyone that putting an imbalance of hormones into a mother may lead to her child having fucked up hormones too?

Therefore the child, perhaps a boy? Has fucked up hormones, this leads to confuse a person in to which sex they prefer. Making the child homosexual.

Am I crazy or what?

Actually more of the issue with this is that it’s making it’s way into our water systems.

There is a lot of estrogen in our water now, and a lot of other chemicals which mimic it.
[/quote]
They are slowly making everyone gay :eek: somebody get me the president[/quote]

k call 1800-cocksucker and ask for bush

Read full topic

item.title: Gay Marriage
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“n33bz0rpl0x, post:52, topic:226624”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=297807.msg2395501#msg2395501 date=1219145229]

I’m not one of those flamboyant girly gays.

That’s the only type of gay person I like! You just know the serious ones have way to much man-on-man action.

Bitchplease.
They, honestly, annoy me. I hate the whole extenuation of the “s”, like, thatssss sssexy.

I didn’t mean that he was touching you. My ‘theory’ is that gay men become gay because they miss their father in a big part of their developing stage. But now I find that that is bullshit because that developing stage is from 0 to about 8 years old.

I honesty don’t know if it’s Nature or Nurture, myself. But during primary school and such i was always around sports and guy friends. It was just like, I knew at around 13 or something that i was more attracted to guys then girls.
[/quote]

don’t yell at me for this, but, if your attracted to a girl in anyway shape or form, maybe your bisexual? just a thought[/quote]
Why would i yell at you? I can look at girls and go “She’s stunning”, but i wouldn’t do anything more than kiss a girl. Vagina’s are just a no-go zone. I poke girls boobs all the time though, fun and squishy.

Read full topic

item.title: Gay Marriage
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:48, topic:226624”]I’ll stick by my previous statement, I still believe that being gay is a choice. As Kane accurately said up higher I cannot prove that I am right, but also he cannot prove that he is right. It all boils down to what you believe.

As to the issue of gay marriage, since I believe it is a choice to be gay I believe that two gay people should not be allowed to get married. If you choose to be gay, you choose to not get married, simple as that.

The issue actually came up on the voting ballot in the state of Ohio where I live a few years ago, about 85% of the population including me voted to not allow gay marriage in our state. Therefore obviously the vast majority of the population agrees with me.[/quote]
I can’t prove that I’m right, I don’t have facts, But I can tell you from a Gay mans perspective.
You think if i had the choice to be straight or gay i’d choose gay?

Oh, 'cause i hear gay is now in and nobody bashes gay people and they don’t get discriminated, or anything.
It doesn’t make sense.

Read full topic

item.title: Gay Marriage
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I’ll stick by my previous statement, I still believe that being gay is a choice. As Kane accurately said up higher I cannot prove that I am right, but also he cannot prove that he is right. It all boils down to what you believe.

Why you you believe that though? Regular attraction has been proven to not be a choice, and rather based on survival and reproductive values. What makes you think that attraction for the opposite sex is different?

Read full topic

item.title: Gay Marriage
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

I Don’t hate gays, and i don’t hate this idea of marriage, but do you really think this is going to be aloud, The president is a cocksucker, and I was told by a teacher thats its against the Law what the fuck is up with this? i have many gay friends. i don’t hate any of them, but i think people need to understand, even if you are a different sex, you can still love each other. also, just leading off into a bit of gay-conversation, people don’t want to see gay people as fully-demensional. i had a friend that was gay back in the 6th grade, he told a friend and a friend told everyone, he ended up killing himself in the school bathroom, it was all over the news. the people that bully people about being gay, become so psychologically damaged that suicide seems the only option. what im trying to say is. i don’t think gay marriage is going to be aloud anytime soon. Lifes, a bitch then you die. its not fair.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 24, 2008, 22:26:21[/size][hr][quote=“Greeny, post:8, topic:226624”]All homosexuals should be shot at the altar.[/quote]

go to limbo, poo face

Read full topic

item.title: Gay Marriage
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ll stick by my previous statement, I still believe that being gay is a choice. As Kane accurately said up higher I cannot prove that I am right, but also he cannot prove that he is right. It all boils down to what you believe.

As to the issue of gay marriage, since I believe it is a choice to be gay I believe that two gay people should not be allowed to get married. If you choose to be gay, you choose to not get married, simple as that.

The issue actually came up on the voting ballot in the state of Ohio where I live a few years ago, about 85% of the population including me voted to not allow gay marriage in our state. Therefore obviously the vast majority of the population agrees with me.

Read full topic
